FOSS means that users control their software. When users get the freedom to change their software, they can meet their own needs. Grimwire allows users to reconfigure and rewrite their applications, then share the result.

Privacy is a priority. In-document servers provide an interface to the browser's storage tools (such as session storage) making it easy to keep sensitive data with the user. If there's ever a problem, users can open up the "Applications" interface, clone the program, and alter it to use an endpoint they control.
